intro: Aristea recisa, commonly known as the silver chalice, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces bracts that resemble a cup or chalice, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, Aristea recisa is widely cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
